summary: This document is an email correspondence discussing financial discussions involving key players in Dubai's financial sector. Jes Staley is forwarding a message from Brian Sankey, who outlines the involvement of several individuals in financial discussions related to the Dubai Financial Support Fund and the Supreme Fiscal Committee.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the sender of the email, forwarding information regarding financial discussions.

persons.name: Brian Sankey
persons.context: Brian Sankey is providing details about key players in financial discussions in Dubai.

persons.name: Hani X Deaibes
persons.context: Hani X Deaibes is included in the email chain and is mentioned as being in contact with other key players.

persons.name: Marwan Abedin
persons.context: Marwan Abedin is identified as a key player in the financial discussions, working with the Dubai Dept of Finance.

persons.name: Abdul A:i: Al-Muhairi
persons.role: M.D. of Investment Corp. of Dubai
persons.context: Abdul A:i: Al-Muhairi is mentioned as being engaged but less involved in the discussions.

persons.name: Hamad al Hurr
persons.role: Under Secretary at the Abu Dhabi Dept. of Finance
persons.context: Hamad al Hurr is mentioned as being in contact with Hani and reporting directly to the Crown Prince.

persons.name: Shaikh Mohammed
persons.context: Shaikh Mohammed is referenced as the Crown Prince to whom Hamad al Hurr reports.

connections.description: Hani is in contact with Hamad al Hurr regarding financial discussions.
Both are involved in the financial discussions related to the Dubai Financial Support Fund.
Hamad al Hurr reports directly to Shaikh Mohammed, the Crown Prince.

keyFacts: The email discusses financial discussions involving key players in Dubai's financial sector.
Marwan Abedin is identified as a key player in discussions related to the Dubai Financial Support Fund.
Hani X Deaibes is mentioned as being in contact with Hamad al Hurr regarding these discussions.
Abdul A:i: Al-Muhairi is noted as being engaged but less involved in the discussions.
Hamad al Hurr reports directly to the Crown Prince, Shaikh Mohammed.
